00116 #define NUM_CMDS ( sizeof(Commands) / sizeof(Commands[0]) )
00117 
00118 #define SCRIPT_SIZE 3
00119 static const char SciptCmdList[SCRIPT_SIZE][8] =  { "ECB", "HELP", "TCB",};
00120 
00121 /*
00122 *********************************************************************************************************
00123 *                                            File-level VARIBALES
00124 *********************************************************************************************************

00126 static char input_line[TOTAL_CMDS][MAX_INPUT];
00127 static INT8U AutoModeStatus = AUTO_MODE_UNLOCKED;
00128 
00129 /*$PAGE*/
00130 /*
00131 *********************************************************************************************************
00132 *                                        Man
00133 *
00134 * Description: This function supports man command of the shell. The man command is used to print 
00135 *              the help text of the command.
00136 *
00137 * Arguments  : cmdArgs - a pointer to the rest of the command that was entered by the user.
00138 *
00139 * Returns    : none
00140 *
00141 * Note(s)    :
00142 *********************************************************************************************************
00143 */
00144 static INT8U Man( char *cmdArgs)
00145 {
00146    INT8U found = 0, index = 0; 
00147    INT8U err = ILLEGAL_NUMBER_ARGS; 
00148    
00149    cmdArgs = mystrtok(NULL, ' '); /* Process the string */  
00150    if (cmdArgs != NULL)           /* If there no more tokens then get out */
00151         err = OK;
00152 
00153    if (err == OK)                   /* If there were enough arguments then return */
00154    {
00155        while ((index < NUM_CMDS) && (!found))
00156        {
00157            if (strcmp(cmdArgs, Commands[index].CmdName) == 0)
00158                found = 1;
00159            else
00160                    index++;              /* increment the counter */
00161        } 
00162 
00163        if (found == 1)    /* If not found then discard this command */
00164        {
00165             SerialPutString(&Commands[index].HelpText[0]); 
00166             SerialPutString("\r\n");
00167        }
00168        else
00169        {
00170             SerialPutString("NO Such command\r\n");            
00171        }    
00172    }
00173    
00174    return err; 
00175 }
00176 
00177 /*$PAGE*/
00178 /*
00179 *********************************************************************************************************
00180 *                                        help
00181 *
00182 * Description: This function supports man command of the shell. The help command is used to all the commands
00183 *              and their brief descriptions.
00184 *
00185 * Arguments  : cmdArgs - a pointer to the rest of the command that was entered by the user.
00186 *
00187 * Returns    : none
00188 *
00189 * Note(s)    : 
00190 *********************************************************************************************************
00191 */
00192 static INT8U Help( char *cmdArgs){
00193    INT8U index= 0;  
00194    INT8S err = ILLEGAL_NUMBER_ARGS;
00195    
00196    cmdArgs = mystrtok(NULL, ' '); /* Process the string */
00197    if ( cmdArgs == NULL)          /* There should no more tokens */
00198    {
00199        err = OK;   
00200        while (index <NUM_CMDS)
00201        {
00202           SerialPutChar('(');
00203           SerialPutString(Commands[index].CmdName);
00204           SerialPutString(") -");
00205           SerialPutString(Commands[index].HelpText);
00206           SerialPutString("\r\n");
00207               index++;
00208        }
00209    } 
00210 
00211    return err;
00212 }

00218 *                                        ScriptingMode
00219 *
00220 * Description: This function is simple static helper function that calls downloads a file over 
00221 *              xmodem, then parse all data into strings and calls command processor for each 
00222 *              line to be processed.
00223 *
00224 * Arguments  : none.
00225 *
00226 * Note(s)    : 
00227 *********************************************************************************************************
00228 */
00229 static void ScriptingMode(){
00230 #if 0
00231    INT8S rc;
00232    
00233    SerialPutString("NOW SEND THE FILE THROUGH XMODEM (CTRL-X to cancel)\r\n");
00234    rc = XmodemDownload(&ScriptFileBuffer[0]);
00235    if (rc > 0)        
00236    {
00237       SerialPutString("\r\nSuccess.\r\n");
00238    }
00239    else if (rc == XM_TIMEOUT)
00240    {
00241       SerialPutString("\r\nTimeout.\r\n");
00242    }
00243    else if (rc == XM_CANCELLED)
00244    {
00245       SerialPutString("\r\nAborted.\r\n");

00247 #endif
00248 #if 1
00249    INT8U index = 0;
00250    SerialPutString("\r\nSkipping XMODEM download.\r\n");
00251    while (index < SCRIPT_SIZE)
00252    {      
00253       ProcessUserInput((char*) &SciptCmdList[index][0]);
00254       index++;
00255    }
00256 #endif  
00257 
00258    SerialPutString("Automate Done.\r\n");
00259    AutoModeStatus = AUTO_MODE_UNLOCKED; /* So we don't start scripting when in script mode */
00260 }

00262 /*$PAGE*/
00263 /*
00264 *********************************************************************************************************
00265 *                                        AutoMode
00266 *
00267 * Description: This function supports automate command of the shell. The automate command place the shell
00268 *              scripting mode.
00269 *
00270 * Arguments  : cmdArgs - a pointer to the rest of the command that was entered by the user.
00271 *
00272 * Returns    : none
00273 *
00274 * Note(s)    :
00275 *********************************************************************************************************
00276 */ 
00277 static INT8U AutoMode( char *cmdArgs){  
00278    INT8U err = ILLEGAL_NUMBER_ARGS; 
00279 
00280    cmdArgs = mystrtok(NULL, ' '); /* Process the string */
00281    if ( cmdArgs == NULL)          /* There should no more tokens */
00282    {
00283        err = OK;   
00284 
00285        if (AutoModeStatus == AUTO_MODE_LOCKED)
00286          err = ILLEGAL_CMD;
00287        else
00288           AutoModeStatus = AUTO_MODE_LOCKED;
00289     }
00290 
00291     return err;
00292 }
00293 
00294 /*$PAGE*/
00295 /*
00296 *********************************************************************************************************
00297 *                                        ProcessUserInput
00298 *
00299 * Description: This function parses user's input and calls the correct function to handle the command.
00300 *
00301 * Arguments  : processCmd -- a pointer to a null-terminated string.
00302 *
00303 * Returns    : none
00304 *
00305 * Note(s)    :
00306 *********************************************************************************************************
00307 */
00308 static void ProcessUserInput(const char *processCmd){
00309    char *cmdName;
00310    INT8U found = 0, index = 0, err = 0;
00311    char command[MAX_INPUT] = {0};  
00312    memcpy(command, processCmd, MAX_INPUT); /* Copy the string into a temp to avoid modification */
00313 
00314    cmdName = mystrtok(command, ' '); /* Process the string */
00315    while(index < NUM_CMDS && !found)
00316    {
00317        if (strcmp(cmdName, Commands[index].CmdName) == 0)
00318            found = 1;
00319        else
00320                index++;              /* increment the counter */
00321    } 
00322 
00323    if (!found)    /* If not found then discard this command */
00324       err = ILLEGAL_CMD;
00325 
00326    /* If it read/write make sure the variables */
00327    if ( (Commands[index].Process != NULL) && found)
00328       err = Commands[index].Process(NULL);
00329 
00330    if (err != OK)
00331    {
00332       SerialPutString((char*) &ErrorMsgs[err][0]);
00333           SerialPutString("\r\n");
00334    }
00335 }
00336 
00337 /*$PAGE*/
00338 /*
00339 *********************************************************************************************************
00340 *                                        OSShellTaskStart
00341 *
00342 * Description: This OSShellTaskStart function is called by OS when the Shell task registered and started up.
00343 *              This function continously waits for user input and calls command processor function to
00344 *              process the command.
00345 *
00346 * Arguments  : pdata -- ignored.
00347 *
00348 * Returns    : none
00349 *
00350 * Note(s)    :
00351 *********************************************************************************************************
00352 */
00353 void OSShellTaskStart(void *pdata){
00354    char inchar = 0;
00355    INT16U currentCmd = 0, escactive = 0;
00356    INT16S index, found = 0, nextCmd = 0, prevCmd = 0;
00357    
00358    /* Prevent compiler warning */
00359    pdata = pdata;  
00360 
00361    SerialPutString(logo);           /* Print the startup logo */
00362 
00363    /* We never exit this */
00364    while(1)  
00365    { 
00366       if (AutoModeStatus == AUTO_MODE_LOCKED)
00367         ScriptingMode();
00368  
00369       SerialPutString("/admin/$ ");
00370 
00371       index = 0;      
00372       /* Get user input while avoiding buffer overflow */
00373       while(index < MAX_INPUT)
00374       {
00375          /* Get the next byte */
00376          inchar = SerialGetChar();
00377 
00378          /* Keep processing until there is enter key */
00379          if (inchar == '\r') 
00380                break;
00381 
00382                  /* Service non-ascii keys */
00383          if (escactive == 2)
00384          {
00385             /* Set the command number */
00386             found = -1;
00387 
00388             /* 
00389              * Modify this command to look exactly like last one. 
00390              * If the is first command ever then discard this character. 
00391              */
00392             if (inchar == 'A')
00393             { 
00394                /* Determine the next command */
00395                while ((currentCmd != prevCmd) && (found == -1))
00396                {
00397                   if ((input_line[prevCmd][0] != '\0') && (nextCmd != currentCmd))
00398                      found = prevCmd; 
00399                   
00400                   /* Unlock the nextCmd */
00401                   nextCmd = prevCmd;
00402 
00403                   /* Decrement the count */
00404                   prevCmd--;
00405                   
00406                   /* Prevent overflow */ 
00407                   if (prevCmd == -1)
00408                      prevCmd = (TOTAL_CMDS-1);
00409                }
00410             }
00411 
00412             /* 
00413              * Modify this command to look exactly like last one
00414              * user scrolled up to see. If the is first command 
00415              * ever or the user hasn't scrolled up to see previous
00416              * then discard this character. 
00417              */
00418             if (inchar == 'B')
00419             { 
00420                /* Determine the next command */
00421                while ((currentCmd != nextCmd) && (found == -1))
00422                {
00423                   /* Compute the next command */ 
00424                   nextCmd = (nextCmd + 1) % TOTAL_CMDS;
00425 
00426                   /* Make sure we don't step over current command */
00427                   if (nextCmd == currentCmd)
00428                      break;
00429 
00430                   /* Unlock the prevCmd */
00431                   prevCmd = nextCmd;
00432 
00433                   /* Handle paritial full array of commands */
00434                   if (input_line[nextCmd][0] != '\0')
00435                      found = nextCmd; 
00436                }
00437             }
00438 
00439                         /* If found an entry then let process it */
00440             if (found != -1)
00441             {
00442 
00443                while (index)
00444                {
00445                   SerialPutChar(BACKSPACE);
00446                   SerialPutChar(' ');
00447                   SerialPutChar(BACKSPACE);
00448                   index--;
00449                }
00450 
00451                while( input_line[found][index] != '\0')
00452                {
00453                   input_line[currentCmd][index] = input_line[found][index];
00454                   SerialPutChar(input_line[currentCmd][index]);
00455                   index++;
00456                }
00457             }
00458             
00459             escactive = 0;
00460             continue;
00461          }
00462 
00463          /* Echo character, digits and whitespace */   
00464          if (isspace(inchar) || isdigit(inchar) || isalpha(inchar))
00465          {
00466             SerialPutChar(inchar);       
00467             if (isalpha(inchar) && islower(inchar))   /* Convert all lower case to upper */
00468                 inchar = inchar - 32; 
00469             input_line[currentCmd][index] = inchar;                       
00470             index++;
00471          }
00472          else if (inchar == BACKSPACE && index)
00473          {
00474             /* if the character equals back space */
00475             SerialPutChar(BACKSPACE);
00476             SerialPutChar(' ');
00477             SerialPutChar(BACKSPACE);
00478             index--;
00479          }
00480          else if (inchar == ESC)
00481          {
00482             escactive = 1;
00483          }
00484          else if (inchar == '[' && escactive == 1)
00485          {
00486             escactive = 2;
00487          }
00488          else
00489          {
00490             /* It's a char we don't recognize at all: ignore it */
00491          }
00492       }
00493     
00494       /* Move the cursor to next line */
00495       SerialPutString("\r\n");
00496 
00497       /* Command is too long */
00498           if (index == MAX_INPUT) 
00499           {
00500           SerialPutString((char*) &ErrorMsgs[CMD_TOO_LONG][0]);
00501               SerialPutString("\r\n");
00502                   continue;
00503           }
00504 
00505       /* process users request */
00506       if (inchar == '\r' && index)
00507       {
00508          /* NULL terminate the string. */
00509          input_line[currentCmd][index++] = '\0';
00510 
00511                    /* Process the command. Pass by value */
00512          ProcessUserInput((char*) &input_line[currentCmd]);
00513          
00514                    /* Increment the command count number */
00515          nextCmd = prevCmd = currentCmd; 
00516          currentCmd = (currentCmd + 1) % TOTAL_CMDS;
00517       }
00518    } /* while */
00519 }
00520 #endif /* ENABLE_SHELL */
